tagDescription: Goods consigned to Baring Bros. & Co. on American account - London - Liverpool.
Crisis with regard to sundry American accounts - Deferred balances.
J.T. Soutter, Bank of the Republic: Virginia Sterling Bonds.
Solon Humphreys to Russell Sturgis - Relative to Bonds of Missouri.
Case of Shrock vs Spielmann.
P.W. Doyle: Reports rumour that F. Lizardi converted £20,000 of bonds to his own use.
Montague Leverson to Baring Bros. & Co. - Re a plan for putting an end to the litigation following the British Bank Swindle.
John L. Lathrop to Baring Bros. & Co. - Re second mortgage Bond of the Central Military Tract Railroad, enclosed to them by J.M. Forbes.
Fraser, Trenholm & Co. to Baring Bros. & Co.: Relative to South Carolina securities.
T.W. Parsons, Boston, to [Joshua Bates] - Relative to the affairs of this father, Thomas W. Parsons, who died in 1854.
C.F. Hovey & Co. to Baring Bros. & Co.: Further in explanation of their foreign accounts.
J.M. Forbes to Baring Bros. & Co. Enclosing copy of a Bond of the City of Quincy, convertible into Stock of the Northern Cross Railroad.
Joshua Bates: Political news; Arbitration of the Central American Question. Freedom of the press causes friction between Belgium & France.
Raband Freres & Cie: Wheat & flour trade.
L.P. Bayne (Seldon, Withers & Co.) to Baring Bros. & Co. Enclosing Resolution of Board of Public Works, Richmond, Virginia, with regard to Contract entered into with them through his agency.
Morris L. Hallowell & Co.: Business reference to Stuart & Bros. of Philadelphia, and David Stuart & Co. of Liverpool.
Ferd de Lesseps to Baring Bros. & Co.: Enclosing a work recently published by him on the cutting through the Isthmus of Suez by a Canal - Comments upon the undertaking.
J.C. Burnham & Co. to Baring Bros. & Co.: Comments on the prospects of the Sugar Trade.
C.H. Fisher to Baring Bros. & Co.: Further on the affairs of the Pennsylvania Bank.
Edwin Bartlett: Refers to commissions charged by Cavan Brothers & Co.
A.W. Gifford, Richmond, Virginia, to ---- On the subject of sending an Agent to England to negotiate a Loan with Baring Bros. & co., making them their sole Agents.
W.H. Swift to Messrs. Matheson & Co.: Proposing a modification of the order relating to payments on account of principal of registered Bonds (Illinois & Michigan Canal) held in Europe.
P.W. Doyle: Refers to the Mexican Bondholders.
Bowman, Grinnell & Co. to Baring Bros. & Co.: Re. business connected with some consignments of theirs.
H. Schaeffer: Credit reference for J.D. Shaw, Cadiz, Spain. Reports rising prices but abundant money supply.
Arch. Gracie: Cotton.
J.M. Forbes to Baring Bros. & Co.: Re. sale of his Michigan Central and other Bonds.
T.G. Cary Jr. to R.M. Sturgis - Gives an instance to show the danger of honouring their letters of credit without a copy of the signature of the person presenting them.
C.H. Fisher: Sales of bonds of the Pennsylvania Railroad Company.
Louisville and Nashville Railway - Description of Securities - County and City Bonds (Press Copy)
W.H. Smith: Refers to acceptance of Strong & Smith; other banking and exchange business.
J.C. Burnham to Baring Bros. & Co.: Re. certain shipments of molasses, sugar &c.
L.P. Bayne to Joshua Bates: Relative to the suspension of Selden, Withers & Co.
Robert Bunch, H.B.M.'s Consul for North and South Carolina, to Thos. Baring M.P. On the subject of the Subscription to the Hospital & Church for British Emigrants.
J.M. Forbes: Urges investment in doubtful American securities because of the possibility of war in Europe.
D. Leavitt: Refers to his claim in connection with the loan of $1,600,000 for the Illinois & Michigan Canal.
D.J. Tallant of San Francisco: Request for credit for the firm of Tallant & Wilde.
Thomas Baring: Spanish Loan.
J.L. O'Sullivan to Baring Bros. & Co.: Re estimates submitted to them in connection with certain works to be erected by a company formed in England.
P. Cadell, Quartzburg, Mariposa County: Quartzburg Water Co. affairs.
Jas. T. Soutter, Bank of the Republic: Virginia Sterling Bonds.
T. Baring to J. Bates - Relative to the French Loan.
J.C. Burnham & Co.: Sugar market.
C.M. Lewis, Farmers & Mechanics Bank; Request for credit.
Joel W. White, President Norwich and Worcester Railroad Co. to Baring Bros. & Co. - Enquires re negotiation of the sale of Massachusetts Bonds in the English market.
J.C. Burnham & Co.: Difficulties in insuring the ship Wabamo.
B.B. Titcomb to Baring Bros. & Co.: Wishes a Loan of £6050.
Baring Bros. & Co. to J.D. Powles, Chairman of the Committee of Spanish American Bondholders. Relative to transfer of the agency of the Committee to Zimmermann, Frazier & Co. Draft Copy
Edwin Bartlett: Sells Panama Bonds for £225.
James Robb: Declines to prepare memorial in connection with the Planters Bank Bonds in Mississippi.
Fay, Mudge & Attwood to Baring Bros. & Co.: In relation to their future account with them.
Edwin Bartlett: Demand for the stock of the Panama Railroad. Closing the charter of the St. Louis.
McCall, Blake & Fairchild: Refers to consignment to J.G. Adam of Glasgow.
C.J. Brydges to J.V. L. Pruyn; Relative to 4935 shares held by New York Central in Great Western Railroad Co.
Jecker, Torre & Co.: Refers to the Indemnity Funds, and the Bondholders suit.
Thomas Baring: Refers to Ward's selection of agents and other business matters.
John H.B. Latrobe to T.W. Ward - Interesting comments on the political situation.
Edwin Bartlett to Baring Bros. & Co.: Statement of the affairs of the Panama Railroad.
George H. White: Comments on Resolution of the Committee of the Bondholders.

L.P. Bayne to Baring Bros. & Co.: Enclosing printed copy of their agreement with the State of Virginia - and the Virginia & Tennessee Railroad. Comments upon the consequences of the suspension of Selden, Withers & Co.

Anthony Barclay, H.B.M's Consul for New York & Robert Bunch H.B.M's Consul for North and South Carolina, to Baring Bros. & Co.: Relative to their having given Mr. Robert Minturn a Power of Attorney to demand from them a sum of money paid to Mr. Bunch for a proposed Hospital and Church for British Emigrants. Then follows a detailed statement of the whole proceedings in the case.
Fullerton & Raymond: Refers to Weardale Pig Iron.
Richard Lewis, Secretary Royal National Life Boat Institution to T. Baring, M.P. with reference to letter of R.B. Forbes concerning Life belts &c.
Fullerton & Raymond: Introducing Almon W. Griswold in connection with shipping iron to the United States.
T.W. Ward to T. Baring, M.P.: Introducing G. Rowland Shaw - (press copy)
Henry A. Stone to Baring Bros. & Co.: informs them of changes in the firm - Geo. E. Stone to retire and the business to be carried on by Mr. Bates, James M. Stones and Charles Lord.
Thos. Swann, President North Western Virginia Railroad Co., to Baring Bros. & Co. Relative to affairs of the Company.
Sir F. Baring to Charles Young: Refers to Mair.
Letter to the Editor of The Times from M.F. Klaucke on his own case of imprisonment for debt &c.
David Leavitt to W.H. Swift - Submitting a statement of services rendered by him - with evidence that his claim for compensation is reasonable. N.B. Several documents enclosed.
Selden, Withers & Co.: Virginia Bonds.
T. Baring to ________ Conditions of the Bank of France - Encloses letter from F. de P. Falconnet.
C.A. Davis; Disposal of debit balance of account in the case of death.
H.P. Sturgis to Baring Bros. & Co.: Business affairs.
Memo. of Fay, Mudge and Attwood's Sterling account.
John C. Ball: Requests favourable disposition of shipment of consignment.

Address to [Governor of South Carolina] from [Baring Bros. & Co.] with respect to propositions which have been suggested by which so much of the security of the Loan as rests on the Bank of the State of South Carolina will be withdrawn by a termination of the Bank.
Joshua Bates: Wheat trade; Prices of coffee and tea.
Zimmermann, Frazier & Co. to Baring Bros. & Co.: Relative to the transfer of certain South American Stock certificates.
Overend, Gurney & Co.; Encloses cheque for £100,000.
C. Edward Habicht to Baring Bros. & Co.: Enclosing statement of the Terre Haute & Alton Railroad Co.
Horace Gray, Jr.: The Arroys Estate. Delay in remittance of money
Ferdinand White, United Service Club: Present of pistols.
J.C. Burnham & Co.: Enclose copy of letter of 10/1/1854.
Wm. Powell, Cincinnati: Thinks Jas. Matthews & Co. is unreliable. Linseed trade.
J.C. Burnham & Co.: Consignment of sugar per ship Wabamo.
C.F. Hovey & Co. to Baring Bros. & Co.: An explanation in reference to their foreign accounts.
J.M. Forbes to Baring Bros. & Co.: Re. Bonds of Michigan Central Railroad. (?)
J.C. Burnham to Baring Bros. & Co.: Arrangements re. covering his account.
J. Hunter to Baring Bros. & Co.: Warning them of the fraudulent issue of 20000 New York & New Haven Railroad Shares.
J.T. Soutter, Bank of the Republic: Virginia Sterling Bonds.
J.C. Burnham & Co.: Sugar trade.
W.P. Tatham to Baring Bros. & Co.: Comments on the financial affairs of the country - encloses Article 8 of the Constitution of the State of New York as to banks suspending payment.
Edwin Bartlett to Baring Bros. & Co.- Panama Railroad affairs - enclosing statement of the income account for six months ending 31 December 1855.
D.J. Tallant: Cancels credit with Barings as conditions are unacceptable.
Overend, Guerney & Co. to Baring Bros. & Co.: Acknowledging the receipt of Bonds of the Panama Railroad Co.
Francis P. Corbin to J. Bates - Mississippi affairs.
Telegram - Hottinguer to Baring Bros. & Co. Re James Odier's affairs;
Lewis Vernet: Scheme of settlement on the River Plate abandoned. Buenos Ayres Bonds.
Francis Spies, Secretary: Panama Railroad Report.
J.C. Burnham & Co.: Renewal of credit sugar market.
C.E. Habicht to J. Bates - Notifies him of change in his firm - Mr. Hyerdahl being dropped and Mr. Henry Parish Jr. taken - the firm now being Habicht and Parish.
Thos. Baring to Joshua Bates - Relative to the purchase of a supply of wheat and flour for the Government of France, in the United States.
Sam. J. Randall: Hopes for a satisfactory arrangement with T.W. Ward.
Fay, Mudge & Attwood to Baring Bros. & Co.: Asking information with regard to accepters of bills remitted by them.
Horace Gray: Intention of Wm. Gray of Boston to connect with an English Exchange firm.
J.M. Forbes to Baring Bros. & Co. - Re Iron to be shipped to New Orleans.
Robert Garrett & Sons to Baring Bros. & Co.: Relative to the Bonds of the Steubenville & Indiana Railroad Co.
Henry Parish (Paris) to Russell Sturgis- Requesting information of standing and character of the London firm Geo. A. Thompson & Co., and of Mr. Commell, connected with the Glasgow Bank.

W.H. Swift to Baring Bros. & Co.: Commenting on the affairs of several Railroads, Erie, Illinois Central, Grant Trunk, Pennsylvania Central, Baltimore & Ohio, Panama, New York Central and Michigan Central.
Lee, Higginson & Co., Boston: Claim account was not overdrawn.
Wm. H. Macfarland, to R.H. Maury to Co.: Supports his application for agency in Virginia.
Lee Higginson & Co.: Refers to exchange operation between England & the United States.
Edwin Bartlett to Baring Bros. & Co.: Re new issue of second mortgage Bonds of the Panama Railroad Co. and affairs of the road generally.
Thomas Baring: Order to A. Gracie for cotton; reference to Spanish Bonds holders.
C.H. Fisher to Baring Bros. & Co.: Pennsylvania Bank affairs.
J.M. Forbes: Cuba and the new minister, the Hon. C.A. Dodge.

J.K. Lothrop to T. Baring, M.P.: Transmits vote of thanks from the Trustees of the Humane Society of Massachusetts for various drawings and plans of life boats &c. from him in his capacity of Chairman of the Royal Life Boat Association.
Bowman, Grinnell & Co. to Baring Bros. & Co.: Information re certain bills held against them.
Wm. Appleton to J. Bates - Informing him of the non-payment of the notes of the Michigan Central Railroad.
W. Grayson Mann to Baring Bros. & Co.: Re his Mexican Bonds - Mexican affairs.
Fox, Henderson & Co., London & Messrs Torlonia & Co.: The Darien Canal Co. The East Kent Railway Co.
Thomas Corwin to T. Baring, M.P.: Introducing Charles Remelin.
C.H. Fisher to Baring Bros. & Co.: Pennsylvania Bank affairs.
C.H. Fisher to Baring Bros. & Co.: Mr. John Welsh's refusal to accept the Presidency of the Pennsylvania Bank.
J.M.Forbes to Baring Bros. & Co.: Enquiry re commercial standing of Sir Charles Fox (of the Crystal Palace).
Samuel J. Randall to Baring Bros. & Co. Relative to a Loan of $500,000 to the City of Philadelphia - enclosing printed statement of terms of Loan.
L.P. Bayne: Virginia Sterling Bonds.
J.M. Forbes to Baring Bros. & Co.: Informs them that he has suggested the Hannibal Loan to Hope & Co.
Joshua Bates: Press copy of letter referring to Spanish Loan.
Finances of the City of Savannah.
C.H. Fisher: Sales of bonds of the Pennsylvania Railroad Company.
Henry A. Stone to Baring Bros. & Co.: Business & financial affairs in New York.

W.C. Drinkard, Secretary Board of Public Works, Richmond, Virginia, to Baring Bros. & Co.: Enclosing copy of an order of the Board of Public Works appointing them Agents to sell Virginia Sterling Bonds.
Overend, Gurney & Co.: Agreement to advance £200,000 against the security of Pennsylvania Bonds.
Bowman, Grinnell & Co. to Baring Bros. & Co;: Arrangements made for settlement of certain bills.

P. Cadell Jr., Agent of the Quartzburg Water Company, Mariposa County, California, to Baring Bros. & Co.: Enclosing a Pamphlet of this Company, formed for the development of the permanent resources of Mariposa County.
W.H. Swift to Baring Bros. & Co.: Mr. Leavitt's claim.
Baron Delmar to Baring Bros. & Co.: Enquires re effect on his Ceylon business of a possible war between United States and England.
J.M. Forbes to R. Sturgis. Re. Hannibal and St. Joseph Railroad affairs - Filed with it is a letter from W.H. Swift with comments on Mr. Forbes' letter.
W.C. Drinkard, Board of Public Works: Virginia Sterling Bonds.
T.G. Gary, San Francisco, to Russell Sturgis - Re. his business in the East Indies, Canton &c.
Geo. W. Billings to Thos. Baring M.P.: Suggestions in the interests of the Mississippi Bonholders.
Population, number of Banks, Bank Circulation and Bank Specie of each State at the close of 1857.
David Tod to Baring Bros. & Co. Introducing Jacob Perkins who is visiting England in the interests of Cleveland and Mahoning Railroad Co.
Thomas Baring: Spanish Loan.
D.J. Tallant (Tallant & Wilde) of San Francisco, to Baring Bros. & Co.: With regard to opening an account with them and giving an account of their business, with their several partners.
Theodore Dehon; Refers to the Alleghany County bonds.
A. Wellman Morse to Baring Bros. & Co.: On the subject of Opelousas Railroad Bonds guaranteed by the City of New Orleans, Louisiana.

David Hoadley, Presdt. Panama Railroad Co., to Baring Bros. & Co.: Proposed improvements necessitate the issue of bonds or shares to the extent of one million dollars and would like them to assume the entire issue.
Thomas Baring: Refers to a letter requesting money for Virginia railroads.
Selden, Withers & Co., Exchange Bank: Rails for the Covington & Ohio Railroad. Marketing the 5% Sterling Bonds.
J.C. Burnham & Co.: Sugar market.
Hovey's Balance Sheet.
C. Goethe Baylor to Baring Bros. & Co.: Has secured co-operation of a commercial firm in Mobile to take up his trade enterprise.

J.B. Neitly, Philadelphia, to Baring Bros. & Co.: Relative to the circulation of a rumour that England has a compact with France, unfriendly to the United States, and in the event of success in their war with Russia, will get up a quarrel with the United States.
David Hoadley, Presdt. Panama Railroad Co., to Baring Bros. & Co.: Enclosing copy of a resolution adopted at a special meeting of the Directors.
S.D. Bradford, near Boston: Refers to his claim against the British Government.
C.H. Fisher to Baring Bros. & Co.: Requesting information as to the means, capacity and integrity of the London House of Coates & Co.
Richard S. Fay to Baring Bros. & Co.: Re failure of Lobb, Hallett & Co. of New York.
Isaac Livermore, Treasurer Michigan Central Railroad Co.: Re affairs of the Road.
John M. Forbes to Baring Bros. & Co.: Asking for a conference on the affairs of the Michigan Central Railroad Company.
Joshua Bates. Sales of wheat. Corn market firm.
Joshua Bates to-Young Re foreign Securities - Hottinguer's calculations about the Revenue of the Grant Trunk Railroad.
J.C. Burnham & Co.: Sugar Trade.
Wm. Powell, Cincinnati: Dissolution of partnership of Jas. Matthews & Co. inevitable. Linseed trade.
J.C. Burnham to Baring Bros. & Co.: Concerning their business relations.
Joshua Bates: Fears affect on the Bank of France by the order for $4,000,000 of goods.
J.M. Forbes to T. Baring - The money situation - The Michigan Central Loan.
C. Stetson, President Ohio Life Insurance & Trust Co., to Baring Bros. & Co.: is desirous to effect a Loan on an issue of their Bonds - History of the Company since its foundation in 1834.
Joshua Bates: Wheat & flour trade.
P. Labouchere to Baring Bros. & Co.: Introducing Mr. Valckenier whose services may be of use to them.
Edwin Bartlett: Refers to Usury laws of New York.
J.C. Burnham & Co.: Sugar market.
P.S. Forbes to R. Sturgis - Re changes in the firm of which he is a member.
J.M. Forbes: Order for rails.
James Robb; Introducing V.S. Campbell, Great Northern Railroad co. in connection writ.
Percy W. Doyle to T. Baring - Affairs in Mexico - Enclosing two letters signed W.G. Lettsom, with most graphic description of the Revolution.
Jacob Perkins, President Cleveland and Mahoning Railroad Co., to Joshua Bates. Relative to the financial condition of the Cleveland and Mahoning Railroad Co.
Wm. Gray to R.W. Weston - Forwarding a deed prepared for Mr. Bates.
Richard F. Fay to Baring Bros. & Co.: Re affairs of Fay, Mudge & Attwood.
Arch. Gracie: Cotton market
Edwin Bartlett to Baring Bros. & Co.: Affairs of Panama Railroad Co. - Enclosing Circular.
C.M. Lewis, Farmers & Mechanics Bank, Philadelphia: Exchange & money market.
J.M. Forbes: Refers to his order for 2200 tons of rails.
J.T. Soutter, Bank of the Republic: Board of Public Works obtains bank loan against the security of the Virginia Sterling Bonds.
J.M. Forbes to Baring Bros. & Co. Relative to a Missouri Railroad in which he is interested - and Missouri finances generally.
Chas. Stetson to Baring Bros. & Co.: Re. the Cincinnati, Hamilton & Dayton Railroad Co's Bonds.
Robert Soutter, Jr.: Virginia State Bonds.
C.H. Fisher: Sales of bonds of the Pennsylvania Railroad Co.
I.D. Andrews to T. Baring, M.P.: Enclosing his letter of introduction from Presdt. James Buchanan - Discusses the present financial position.
J.M. Forbes : Shipment and storage of iron.
J.T. Soutter, Bank of the Republic: Virginia Sterling Bonds.
Joshua Bates to-Young - Re. Geo. Ward's concerns and the new partnership of Ward and Campbell.
J.M. Forbes: Business memo.

Copy of Address to Thos. Aspinwall, Consul General of the United States in London, accompanying a gift of a Service of Plate, on the occasion of his leaving England. Sgd/ Baring Bros. & Co. Geo. Peabody et al Also a copy of reply dated 8 February 1854.
Trimmer & Grainger: Discusses failures of consignments of American provisions. Encloses prices current for the procedure.
Joshua Bates: Wheat & flour trade.
Robert Soutter, Jr.: Virginia State Bonds.
J.T. Soutter: Bank of the Republic: Virginia Sterling Bonds.
L.P. Bayne to Joshua Bates: Relative to the condition of the Virginia & Central Railroad Co.
Arch. Gracie: Grain & cotton market.
Hamilton McCall: Acceptance of bills of exchange and other banking business.
P.W. Doyle: Government crisis; Finance minister resigned. Believes the firm of Lizardi will get the agency.
Francis P. Corbin to _________. Enclosing letters from C. Macalister and J. Robb detailing the financial condition of Mississippi.

J.M. Forbes to Baring Bros. & Co.: Re Missouri State Bonds to be received by Hannibal & St.Joseph Railroad Co. endorsed by said Company - enclosing copy of an Act to secure the prompt payment of the interest on Missouri State Bonds, approved 7 December 1855.
P.N. Wood, Cashier of the Union Bank of Louisiana, to Baring Bros. & Co.: Relative to Exchange and other operations of the Bank.
Theodore Dehon: Refers to the Pittsburgh & Connellsville Railroad Co.
Geo. H. White to Baring Bros. & Co. - Re business of affairs of Mr. Boilleau.
Grant & Son to ________ Re. Pennsylvania Bank - the consequences of suspension.
Grant & Stone: Business reference to Dawson & Hancock, shipowners
L.B. Bayne, Bank of the Republic: Virginia Bonds.
Bowman, Grinnell & Co. to Baring Bros. & Co.: Regrets that they are unable to meet the Bill of Exchange held against them - Discuss their financial position.
Theodore Dehor: Portion of letter: Suspects that worthless cheques were paid for huge iron sales. Personal.
Hon. Geo. Eustis, late Chief Justice of Louisiana, to James Robb. Opinion as to the validity of the Bonds issued by City of New Orleans to the New Orleans Jackson & Great Northern Railroad.
Wm. Appleton to Joshua Bates Re. affairs of Michigan Central Railroad.
E.C. McIntosh: Refers to the stock of the Great Western Railway.
Memo on the Michigan Central Railroad.

Sam. F.B. Morse to Joshua Bates - Introducing Cyrus W. Field, Esq., who goes to England for the purpose of promoting harmonious action among the projectors of the Submarine Telegraphic Line between Europe and America.
G. Hooper to Russell Sturgis Enclosing memo of Eastern Railroad financial standing.
Eastern Railroad Equipment.
J.C.B. Davis: Business and character references to Edgar J. Bastow, Henry McFarlan, Lyman Denison, Peter McMarlin, Henry L. Cothead.

W.B. Liot, Royal Mail Steam Packet Line to Mr. Griffin - re renewal of a proposal made to the Company in 1854 on behalf of the Government of Chili for the establishment of monthly line of Steamboats for conveying the Chilian mails between Rio de Janeiro and Valparaiso through the Straits of Magellan.
Theodore Dehon to Baring Bros. & Co.: Relative to affairs of the Pittsburgh & Connellsville Railroad Co.- Financial standing of Pittsburgh& Alleghany County.
W.C. Drinkard: Board of Public Works orders payments of drafts in bonds.
Alf.Penn, President Union Bank of Louisiana (new), to Baring Bros. & Co.: Relative to the affairs of the Bank.
J.M. Forbes to Baring Bros. & Co.: Outlines the position of the Military Tract Co. and the Aurora Railroad Co.
Selden, Withers & Co., Exchange Bank: Virginia loan.

C.G. Baylor to J. Bates - Asking information as to the possibility of his getting a five or seven years' conditional control of the Bonds of Florida, Arkansas and Mississippi, with a view to their payment.
Selden, Withers & Co.: Changes in contract concerning the Virginia bonds.
Hughes Kearsey & Co.: Encloses copy of letter of 24/11/1855 from D.S. Lee, United States Consul in Basle with terms of settlement of the Shrock - Spielmann affair.
C.H. Fisher to Baring Bros. & Co.: Enclosing letters from Gerard Ralston on the subject of the sale of $20000 Cleveland & Mahoning Railroad Bonds.
C.H. Fisher to Baring Bros. & Co. Re affairs of Pennsylvania Railroad Company.
James Odier: Refers to the firm of Charles Odier, New Orleans.
C.H. Fisher: Character reference for Ambrose W. Thompson in connection with management of New York-to-Europe steamship line.
Credits - Alsop & Co. &c - arranged alphabetically.

Edwin Bartlett to Baring Bros. & Co.: Enclosing two letters from David Hoadley, President of the Panama Railroad Co., mortgage Bonds of the Company,-also copy of the Resolution of the Board of Directors giving the President authority to place these Bonds at his disposal.
David Leavitt to Baring Bros. & Co.: Re. proceedings against him in the Supreme Judicial Court of Massachusetts taken by Capt. Swift and their firm.
W.H. Swift to Baring Bros. & Co.: Enclosing and commenting upon a letter from J.M. Forbes with a statement of the affairs of the Hannibal and St. Joseph Railroad.
Wm. Appleton to J. Bates - Commenting on the suspension of the Banks in the country.
C.G. Baylor to Baring Bros. & Co.: Re. Mississippi and Florida Bonds made payable by good management.
J.M. Forbes to Baring Bros. & Co.: Re Hannibal & St.Joseph Railroad and enclosing the form of subscription to the Bonds.
Charles Baring to Baring Bros. & Co.: On the state of his account with Lord Ashburton.
S. Lewis to Wm. H. Swift - Re shares in the Grand Junction Railroad and Depot Co.
C. Stokes & Co.: Circular.
Lewis Vernet to Baring Bros. & Co.: Project relative to negotiation of South American Bonds.
Robert Soutter, Jr. to Russell Sturgis - Relative to sale of Virginia five per Cent Sterling Bonds. Enclosing letter from his brother, James T. Soutter on the same subject.
Selden, Withers & Co. to Baring Bros. & Co,: Relative to Virginia Bonds.
Bowman, Grinnell & Co. to Baring Bros. & Co.: Re. certain bills.
J.M. Forbes to T. Baring, M.P.: Asking information as to how the system works for renewing their supplies of specie.
Thos. Baring to Baring Bros. & Co.: Relative to the Spanish Loan.
Archibald Gracie: Cotton.
Thomas Swann to Baring Bros. & Co.: Concerning a Loan for the Baltimore & Ohio Railroad and the control of it by their House.
H.P. Sturgis to Baring Bros. & Co.: Re failure and affairs of Crocker & Sturgis.
J.M. Forbes to T. Baring M.P.: Relative to Hannibal and St. Joseph Railroad.
J.C. Burnham & Co.: Sugar trade.
J.C. Burnham to Baring Bros. & Co.: Re. the affairs of his house.
Joshua Bates (Carlsbad) to T. Baring - Comments on Turkish & other Loans - Relative to the possible length of the war.
J.C, Burnham & Co.: Refers to insurance of cargo of sugar aboard the Wabamo. Also political views.
A.C. Dodge to Baring Bros. & Co. - Suggesting the appointment of Lord Howden as English Minister to Washington as the surest means of preserving peace between England and United States.
J.M. Forbes: Refers to the Russian decree allowing ships to pass up the Neva River. Hemp market.
Alfred Kelley: Introducing Jacob Perkins in connection with an order for rail for the Cleveland to Philadelphia Railway.
Arch. Gracie; Cotton; Personal.
Blanio E (-)? Chilean affairs.
M.F. Maury, Observatory: Recommends R.H. Maury for the agency in Virginia.

R.B. Forbes to T. Baring - Bringing to his notice the rescue of a British Crew by the American Bark Hamilton - As Chairman of the Standing Committee of Massachusetts Humane Society, makes enquiry re the best type of Life belts, buoys &c.
Grant & Son to Baring Bros. & Co.: Panic caused by the Bank of Pennsylvania (Phila.) having suspended payment.
Joshua Bates. Purchases of 2,000,000 bushels of wheat.
E.C. McIntosh to Baring Bros. & Co.: Statement of New York Central Railroad.
E.A. Freret, Cashier Union Bank of Louisiana to Baring Bros. & Co.: Desires to ascertain under what conditions they would be willing to attend to the business of the Bank.
C.H. Fisher to Baring Bros. & Co.: Suspension of the Pennsylvania Bank.

L.P. Bayne (Seldon, Withers & Co.) to Baring Bros. & Co. Relative to the financial condition of Virginia - Enclosing letter from W.R. Drinkard, Secretary Board of Public Works, Richmond, Virginia, concerning their contract with Baring Bros.& Co.
Overend, Guerney & Co. to Baring Bros. - Acknowledges the receipt of Bonds of the State of Pennsylvania as Collateral security for a loan of £200,000.
J.C. Burnham & Co.: Sugar market.
R.F. Fay to J. Bates - Wishing the firm of Fay, Mudge and Attwood to be re-established with Mr. Ward in Boston.
Joshua Bates: Wheat & flour business.
Ferdinand White, United Service Club: Reports appointment to the Depot Battalion on the Isle of Whight.
Warren Delano Jr. to J. Bates - Re. output of Cumberland Coal in Maryland - plan for its transportation - extension of the Cumberland and Pennsylvania Railroad Co. &c.
Lewis Vernet to Thos. Baring M.P.: Relative to his Colonization Scheme for River Plate District, South America.
Henry T. Parker to Baring Bros. & Co.: Relative to his personal debt.
Grant & Stone: Refers to the case of Arustein & Esckles vs. Wm. Norris.
Joshua Bates: Advises against export of goods to the United States. Refers to the Exhibition and the Nova Scotia Railway.
Baron Bentinck, Netherland Legation, to Baring Bros. & Co.: Introducing Mr. Hartung, from Amsterdam, recommended to him by the Minister of Foreign Affairs at the Hague.
J. Watson Webb to Joshua Bates. Relative to his coal and timber holdings in United States and asking that he and Mr. Sturgis look into the matter.
Lee, Higginson & Co. to Baring Bros. & Co.: Comments upon the financial & commercial depression of the past year.
Baring Brothers & Co. to Messrs Hughes Kearsey & Co.: Enclosure: Bill of charges in the case of Shrock vs Spielmann.
J.M. Forbes to Baring Bros. & Co.: Re. Michigan Central Bonds.
J.M. Forbes to Capt. W.H. Swift or Baring Bros. & Co.: Hannibal & St. Joseph Railroad.
L.P. Bayne to Baring Bros. & Co. Re purchases of Board of Public Works, Richmond, Virginia.
Edward Zimmermann: Charles Cabot will manage the firm in his absence, Rosista party again disturbing the country.
Lee, Higginson & Co.; Complaint about purchases of bills at New Orleans.
